intro: Rhexia cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rhexia cubensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
